intro: Polygonum cunninghamii, commonly known as the silverleaf knotweed, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It features slender, erect stems that are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a distinctive silver or gray-green coloration on the upper surface. Polygonum cunninghamii is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks.
